item.title: Koala Bot Club Talks Game Automation
item.dc:creator: Rod Fuentes
item.description:
Jelly eSports' Twitter Spaces hosts The Koala Bot Club, an NFT project that automates console gaming to improve player experiences.

The post Koala Bot Club Talks Game Automation appeared first on AlphaBack.
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to AlphaBack’s Twitter Spaces Summaries (#TSS). In this series, we summarize Twitter Spaces that you don’t want to miss. Why? Because we all love Twitter Spaces, but dammit if they aren’t difficult to tune into at times ‚Äì whether it’s the inconvenient timing or unedited / off-topic meandering. In this first post of the series, the Koala Bot Club talks about its game automation platform and its integration with the #SolSuite platform.

n.b. Summaries are edited for brevity and inconsistencies may occur due to crosstalk or audio quality. The content presented is not financial advice. Do your own research and review the disclaimer below.

The Koala Bot Club and the SolSuite Platform

@JellyeSportsNFT hosts this Twitter Spaces:

  • @ZooTechNFT represents the The Koala Bot Club, an NFT project that “automates gaming and in-game trading” to make player’s game experiences “affordable and fun.”
  • @ZooTechNFT also:
    • describes his game automation technology, which automatically plays console games on behalf of users to earn experience or other in-game assets.
    • mentioned that the new FIFA season starts in the first week of September and they need to build a base of coins to start selling. He notes that the auction house they get provided by Jelly eSports will be sold a lot.
    • says they are partly paid by the royalties and partly by their partners.
    • adds that they showcased a bot on a Twitch stream showing they‚Äôre capable of botting games on the blockchain.
    • says that people should stake the Koala Bot Club on the #SolSuite staking platform, get the native token, and buy an NFT to participate in their ecosystem.
  • @niftygundog mentions that if someone has ten entities, then they can win every auction.
  • @ZooTechNFT says they will host 0.25 [SOL?] NFT and have bigger NFTs, too. 
  • @B0BBY_18 asks if people can buy FIFA tokens from Koala Club. 
  • @ZooTechNFT says they can‚Äôt sell them for various reasons. But he notes that they are already hosting poker games, and people who believe in the Koala Bot Club will benefit by getting the whitelist role.
  • @lagargola1of1 says they learned about Jelly eSports and found the community to be responsive and communicative.
  • @niftygundog notes that there are people that work for jelly, like mods and community managers, and when holders see somebody in when the community who should be a whitelist recipient, then the mods could make it happen. 
  • @JellyeSportsNFT says there‚Äôs been some exploits, like making fake accounts and using special characters. But the best thing to do is take a screenshot and open up a support ticket.
  • @niftygundog talks about how when “gamble” comes out, $JELLY will go up in price. @niftygundog notes that if you don‚Äôt have enough money to borrow a Rascal, you can have a dog for free.
  • @JellyeSportsNFT says they‚Äôd love to see more people in the holders chat, playing games with them. He notes that Jelly eSports always give back when they can.
  • @PoetryDude_ says there‚Äôs a lot of people that‚Äôs going to give away their JellyDawgs because one is free. 
  • @lagargola1of1 talks about how to turn off their DMs for safety reasons.
  • @niftygundog mentions that if you don’t have Rascals, then buy $JELLY.

Disclaimer & Risks: This summary is for informational and entertainment purposes only and should not be relied upon as a basis for investment decisions. The host and guest may hold NFTs mentioned on the show, but that is not an endorsement or recommendation to buy any tokens or NFTs mentioned. Please do not follow any opinion as a specific strategy. Using crypto applications, wallets, protocols, and tools may expose users to risks including, but not limited to, smart contract bugs, systemic risk, flashloan attacks, economic incentive failures, liquidity crises, admin key exploits, governance exploits, and pegged assets such as stablecoins or tokenized BTC de-pegging.

The post Koala Bot Club Talks Game Automation appeared first on AlphaBack.

item.title: Institutional Capital for NFT Promotions & Progress Upgradeable Contracts
item.dc:creator: Rod Fuentes
item.description:
This week was delightful! We released upgradeable contracts and analytics in staging, and we welcomed an institutional investor on our cap table. We’re making good progress toward onboarding our first 10,000 NFT-friendly users. Highlights Fundraising. We‚Äôre excited to welcome Hashkey Capital in our round, an institutional fund with over 200 portfolio companies that has been […]

The post Institutional Capital for NFT Promotions & Progress Upgradeable Contracts appeared first on AlphaBack.
item.content:encoded:
This week was delightful! We released upgradeable contracts and analytics in staging, and we welcomed an institutional investor on our cap table. We’re making good progress toward onboarding our first 10,000 NFT-friendly users.

Highlights

  • Fundraising. We‚Äôre excited to welcome Hashkey Capital in our round, an institutional fund with over 200 portfolio companies that has been investing exclusively in blockchain technology since 2015.
  • Upgradeable contracts. As mentioned last week, we’ve been working on upgradeable smart contracts. This week, we released that code in our staging environment. Next, we‚Äôll conduct QA and aim for a production release in the next sprint.
  • Analytics. We can now track connected wallets, enabling us to identify users who should receive payments for viewing NFTs

Challenges

  • Deployments. A new code package introduced conflicting dependencies. We lost two days of dev time diagnosing and fixing that issue in our staging environment. Production systems were not affected.

Asks

  • We‚Äôre working on user research and mockups of our next NFT discovery user experience. Signup for a short user interview here.
  • Do you know any NFT collections who would be interested in a simple win-win collaboration? We‚Äôll promote them on AlphaBack, and they encourage their community to install our extension. Here are a few that we‚Äôre approaching:

Food for Thought

We‚Äôve been thinking about traditional advertising models and how we can leverage them to provide users with more yield in the future.

For instance, we can empower users to control their advertising experience, allowing them to offer more data to advertisers in exchange for greater payments. In one scenario, users may get a multiplier on rewards if they connect more wallets. Or perhaps users opt-in to share browser activity and history, leading to another multiplier. We believe these will be rich data sources in the future (post-cookie) advertising world‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääand users should benefit directly from offering their data.

Additionally, we could reward users based on the number of ad views they generate in their typical browsing experience. Cost-per-click campaigns are also possible in the future, where users earn a percentage of each paid click. Similarly, we could introduce cost-per-action campaigns that are uniquely tied to wallet addresses, encouraging higher rewards for users and conversions for advertisers.

That said, we leave those ideas for future implementation because they require careful product development to prevent abuse. Any model where the user benefits from doing more of the paid activity presents a moral hazard. For example, did the user click on the ad to earn money, or were they genuinely interested in the advertised product or NFT? Fortunately, advertising fraud is an old problem with well-established methods for detecting such activity.

But, first things first, we must grow our user base to make all of this possible. So I want to thank you for your support as we climb to 1M users.

Install the AlphaBack Browser Extension today!

The post Institutional Capital for NFT Promotions & Progress Upgradeable Contracts appeared first on AlphaBack.

item.title: Upgradeable Contracts & More Fundraising for our NFT Promotions Ad Network
item.dc:creator: Rod Fuentes
item.description:
We‚Äôre heads down building and fundraising for our NFT promotions ad network, so here‚Äôs another quick weekcap. But first a brief intro in case you‚Äôre new here: AlphaBack is a browser extension that pays users to look at NFTs (ads), with the goal of building a DAO-owned ad network. Also, we‚Äôre experimenting with a new section […]

The post Upgradeable Contracts & More Fundraising for our NFT Promotions Ad Network appeared first on AlphaBack.
item.content:encoded:
We‚Äôre heads down building and fundraising for our NFT promotions ad network, so here‚Äôs another quick weekcap. But first a brief intro in case you‚Äôre new here:

AlphaBack is a browser extension that pays users to look at NFTs (ads), with the goal of building a DAO-owned ad network.

Also, we‚Äôre experimenting with a new section on these Retros called, Food for Thought. Review that (at the bottom of this note) if you want to go deeper.

Highlights

  • Fundraising. We closed three more angel investors on our SAFE!
  • Allocations. We‚Äôre now up to $965,000 in written commitments from investors. This is a 10% increase over last week.
  • Upgradeable Contracts. We‚Äòre laying the foundation for faster iterations and future flexibility via upgradeable contracts. We estimate releasing that code within 2 weeks.

Challenges

  • HackFS Hackathon. We had planned on participating in this hackathon, but prioritizing the release of the payments code meant that we didn‚Äôt have enough time for a meaningful submission.

How You Can Help

  • What do you think about DevCon in Bogot√°? We‚Äôre considering whether to sponsor a small booth there given the amount of foot traffic we can convert ‚Äì like we did at NFT NYC. Hit reply and send me your thoughts.
  • Here‚Äôs an updated list of investors who‚Äôd be interested in meeting us given their web3 thesis and portfolio. LMK if you have any connections with:
    • Jay Reinemann, Propel Venture Partners
    • David Waxman, TenOneTen Ventures
    • Evan Tana, Script Capital
    • Rich Robinson, Animoca Brands
    • Philipp Stauffer, FYRFLY Venture Partners
    • Jeffrey Haas, CoinSmart
    • Paul Veradittakit, Pantera Capital
    • Alex Atallah, Opensea Ventures
    • Kathryn Haun, Haun Ventures

Food for¬†Thought: NFT Promotions are hard.

NFT projects continue to sprout. There are now approximately 80,300 NFT collections on the Ethereum blockchain, up from 15,540 in 2021. And that doesn‚Äôt include the growing number of NFT projects on Solana. Importantly, marketing is a top expense for any NFT project.

A web3 marketing agency, Coinbound, says that ‚ÄúNFT marketing ranges from $10,000 to over $200,000 for a successful NFT marketing campaign.‚Äù According to another agency, ‚Äúestablished NFT brands can spend upwards of ‚Ç¨100,000+ monthly on their marketing to constantly reach out to new investors and broaden their reach. Start-up projects are recommended to have between ‚Ç¨10,000 and ‚Ç¨25,000 if they are really looking to expose their project to as many of the right eyes as possible.‚Äù Given the lack of better promotional alternatives, we believe this market is ripe and can produce meaningful revenue. This (partially) explains why we‚Äôre starting with promoting NFTs as a wedge into the broader advertising opportunity.

Below is a bottom-up calculation that illustrates the potential of the market. First, let‚Äôs determine the potential ad spend per year per project. Marketing budgets for traditional B2C companies typically range from 5 to 25 percent of a company‚Äôs revenue or revenue targets, depending on company size, stage of growth. One survey of SMBs suggests that companies earning less than $2M in revenue spend $14K in online marketing. While a 2019 survey suggests that SMB companies spend $10K‚Äì$50K in online advertising. Let‚Äôs assume that NFT projects have similar marketing spend, approximately $1.2K per month. That amount aligns with the marketing budgets suggested by web3 agencies for NFT projects (above).

Assuming there are 80,300 NFT collections, and they grow 30% YoY, then there may be 104K NFT projects by 2023. NFT collections follow power law distributions, so most of the projects will be small $1.2K/mo advertisers, while a few (1%) will be power users with larger budgets (e.g., 10x higher, as per the web3 agency example ranges above). Therefore, we calculate:

(99% * 104K projects * 1.2K/mo * 12 months) + 
(1% * 104K projects * 10.2K/mo * 12 months) = $1,609,920,000.

In the future, NFT projects will turn to trusted sources of quality advertising to reach broader yet targeted audiences, because the current alternatives are depressing ‚Äì from con artists, Discord shillers, to Twitter feeds littered with these giveaways:

Our goal is to attract enough users to download our extension, such that we can provide a welcome alternative to NFT collections who need to promote their projects.

The post Upgradeable Contracts & More Fundraising for our NFT Promotions Ad Network appeared first on AlphaBack.

item.title: NFT Promoters Can Pay For Ad Space
item.dc:creator: Rod Fuentes
item.description:
Hi Friends üëã this is a quick weekcap, as we‚Äôre heads down building and fundraising. Most importantly, we deployed our payments code, allowing NFT promoters to pay for ad space that is shown to users when they open a new browser tab. Highlights Fundraising. We closed another investor on our YC SAFE, building more momentum […]

The post NFT Promoters Can Pay For Ad Space appeared first on AlphaBack.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Friends this is a quick weekcap, as we‚Äôre heads down building and fundraising. Most importantly, we deployed our payments code, allowing NFT promoters to pay for ad space that is shown to users when they open a new browser tab.

Highlights

  • Fundraising. We closed another investor on our YC SAFE, building more momentum on this financing.
  • Allocations. We‚Äôre now up to¬†$875,000¬†in written commitments from investors.
  • Deployed Payments Code. We deployed the code that takes USDC from NFT promoters and distributes payments to users

Challenges

  • Analytics. We hypothesized that we could use Google Analytics as a data warehouse for our prototype. While pushing data in has been simple, extracting data has been more complex than expected. We‚Äôll try another approach this coming week. If that does not work, then we‚Äôll need to explore other solutions.

How You Can Help

  • We have an updated list of investors who‚Äôd be interested in meeting us given their web3 thesis and portfolio. LMK if you have any inroads here:
  • Sandeep Nailwal @ Polygon
  • Neha Khera @ 2048 Ventures
  • Rachel Soper Sanders @ 2048 Ventures
  • Lawrence Diao @ Dragonfly Capital
  • Hadley Harris @ Eniac Ventures
  • nihal mehta @ Eniac Ventures
  • Ashwin Ramachandran @ Dragonfly Capital
  • Leslie Tam @ GBV Capital
  • John Pagnilinan @ Signum Capital

Food for Thought: How much time is required to onboard a new NFT Promoter?

Our current iteration is self-serve and takes about 5 minutes to deliver an ad to our users. Try it for yourself here. As a prototype, the UX is understandably rough, but all it takes is a few input fields and some USDC in your wallet

Our prior ad:tech startup was focused on providing a self-serve product for what was traditionally an enterprise, managed service. We expect to continue that tradition at AlphaBack, enabling NFT promoters to advertise their collections to NFT enthusiasts via our self-serve interface.

In the future, as we build the ad network, we can plug-in to existing demand side platforms (aka ‚ÄúDSP‚Äù, such as Basis, TradeDesk, MediaMath, etc.). Those are the ‚Äòmedia buying platforms‚Äô for most large advertisers. Integrating our network (inventory) into a DSP means that ad buys will flow to us automatically without having to directly partner with advertisers directly.

Thanks again for your ongoing support and don’t forget to install the Browser Extension today, which allows NFT promoters to reach users whenever they open a “new tab” on their browser.

The post NFT Promoters Can Pay For Ad Space appeared first on AlphaBack.

item.title: Solution to Airdrop USDC & Won a Hackathon
item.dc:creator: Rod Fuentes
item.description:
GM Frens üëã It was an exciting week for AlphaBack.xyz. We won a hackathon and found an elegant solution to airdrop USDC to users. A quick about us in case you‚Äôre new here: AlphaBack is building a browser extension that pays users to look at NFTs (ads), with the goal of building a DAO owned […]

The post Solution to Airdrop USDC & Won a Hackathon appeared first on AlphaBack.
item.content:encoded:
GM Frens It was an exciting week for AlphaBack.xyz. We won a hackathon and found an elegant solution to airdrop USDC to users.

A quick about us in case you‚Äôre new here:

AlphaBack is building a browser extension that pays users to look at NFTs (ads), with the goal of building a DAO owned ad-network.

People hate ads, and advertisers know that. But ads are not going away. In a world where users can choose between (A) look at ads and get $0 or (B) look at ads and get $255 per year from AlphaBack, we strongly believe that users will choose (B) and install our browser plug-in.

On top of monetary incentives, we give users power over their advertising experience, enabling them to give more or less of their data in exchange for more or less payment.

OK, let‚Äôs jump into the weekcap for July 10‚Äì17:

Highlights

  • Won Hackathon! AlphaBack won 2nd place and a $5,000 prize in the Encode x Polygon Hackathon. Next, we‚Äôre competing in the HackFS competition, where we may win up to $100,000 in prizes.
  • Payment Solution. In a past retro, we noted how expensive it can be to airdrop USDC to 100K users ‚Äì even on inexpensive L2 chains, like Polygon. We now have an elegant solution, where we maintain a running balance per user using read requests and an index of their last withdrawal, rather than updating state variables per user balance.
  • Phase 2 Investor Meetings. We‚Äôre now in phase 2, aka ‚ÄúInvestment Committee Meetings,‚Äù with several investors. We‚Äôre also getting more inbound interest via the Stonks deal room. We‚Äôre focusing on cap table composition, optimizing for investors who can help with tokenomics, DAO setup, access to NFT influencers, and/or ad:tech connections.

Obstacles

  • Delayed Release. We found a bug during our pre-release QA, which delayed our deployment. We‚Äôre targeting July 20 for the next code release.

How You Can Help

  • We have an updated list of investors who‚Äôd be interested in meeting us given their web3 thesis and portfolio. LMK if you have any inroads here:
  • Ameet Shah @ Golden Ventures
  • Paul Murphy @ Lightspeed
  • Josh Fraser @ Origin Protocol
  • Asher Devang @ AlphaGrep
  • David Aranoff @ FlyBridge Capital
  • Vivek Sodera @ Superhuman
  • Edith Yeung @ Race Capital
  • Jenny Lefcourt @ Freestyle Capital
  • Patrick Chang @ Dispersion Capital
  • Jules Miller @ Mindset Ventures
  • Brett deMarrais @ Ludlow Ventures

Thanks again for your ongoing support

And remember to install the Browser Extension today!

The post Solution to Airdrop USDC & Won a Hackathon appeared first on AlphaBack.

item.title: Stonks Fundraising & Payments Code Coming¬†Soon
item.dc:creator: Rod Fuentes
item.description:
We‚Äôre keeping this one short because the last update was long and this was a short week for the 4th of July holiday üß® TLDR: after presenting on the Stonks platform, we received an investment from the The Best of Stonks Fund üéâ We’re also testing our payments code in localhost. Highlights Investor Interest. We […]

The post Stonks Fundraising & Payments Code Coming¬†Soon appeared first on AlphaBack.
item.content:encoded:
We‚Äôre keeping this one short because the last update was long and this was a short week for the 4th of July holiday TLDR: after presenting on the Stonks platform, we received an investment from the The Best of Stonks Fund We’re also testing our payments code in localhost.

Highlights

  • Investor Interest. We continue to receive inbound interest via the Stonks deal room. We‚Äôll focus on finding a lead investor that brings web3 and/or ad:tech know-how.
  • Fundraising. We closed our first investor, The Best of Stonks Fund. Papers are executed and they wired the money
  • Local Testing. We began testing our next deployment in localhost, which enables us to receive and distribute payments to users

Obstacles

  • Time Constrained. With so many investor meetings, there‚Äôs less time for product & marketing efforts. Growth this week was inbound and organic only. We‚Äôre excited to close our round so we can push full steam ahead.
  • Support Requests. Our Discord sever is no longer a founders‚Äô chatroom Users are joining and they want to know when they‚Äôre getting paid. While explaining that payments are coming soon is an additional task, it‚Äôs also a signal that somebody gives a . This is good because apathy is the real startup killer. Now‚Äôs the time to be patient and invite more users. #WAGMI

How You Can Help

  • We‚Äôre putting together our fundraising round. Reply if you have intros to investors who are interested in (1) a veteran team of 10Xers who‚Äôve been working together for ten years, (2) DAO / community ownership, or (3) ad targeting in a web3, post-cookie world.
  • Are you familiar with any other high quality NFT conferences? We‚Äôre considering whether to sponsor another small booth so we can have more direct conversations with potential users.

We have a long road ahead of us as we journey to 1M users. Thanks again for your ongoing support.

Don’t forget to install the Browser Extension today!

The post Stonks Fundraising & Payments Code Coming¬†Soon appeared first on AlphaBack.

item.title: Debuted AlphaBack at Tachyon‚Äôs Demo¬†Day
item.dc:creator: Rod Fuentes
item.description:
We concluded our 12-week accelerator program with a bang. On June 30, 2022, we debuted AlphaBack.xyz at Tachyon‚Äôs Demo Day using the Stonks platform. What is AlphaBack? With AlphaBack, users see a promoted NFT‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääinstead of a search bar‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwhen they open a new browser tab. Advertisers pay to promote there because users open ~50 tabs per […]

The post Debuted AlphaBack at Tachyon‚Äôs Demo¬†Day appeared first on AlphaBack.
item.content:encoded:
We concluded our 12-week accelerator program with a bang. On June 30, 2022, we debuted AlphaBack.xyz at Tachyon‚Äôs Demo Day using the Stonks platform.

What is AlphaBack?

With AlphaBack, users see a promoted NFT‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääinstead of a search bar‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwhen they open a new browser tab. Advertisers pay to promote there because users open ~50 tabs per day, averaging 3+ min. of engagement. Via smart contracts, 70% of that money goes to users and 30% goes to our DAO. In time,

our DAO will be the biggest web3 ad / data network that‚Äôs owned by the community, for the community.

The most exciting part of AlphaBack is that we have a huge opportunity to shape the future of advertising in a post-cookie, web3 world. Let‚Äôs unpack that a bit.

In the last ad:tech bull run, companies like BlueKai and LiveRamp built huge businesses leveraging cookies to create data targeting segments. Advertisers paid an average of $3 per 1,000 impressions (CPM) to enable targeting based on those segments, such as job titles, affinities, and more. That‚Äôs on top of the average $2.80 CPM for the ad placement‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääshowing that the targeting data is just as valuable (if not more so) than the ad inventory itself. But the last five years weakened the foundations of cookie-based targeting thanks to GDPR, CCPA, and Apple‚Äôs privacy-enhancing moves. And yet advertisers will continue to crave targeting data for their ad campaigns.

The Future of Ad Targeting

Web3 presents an opportunity to provide appropriate targeting and privacy protections. Imagine a world where millions of AlphaBack users have connected their wallet and consented to be part of our community-owned ad network. With that, we could create a Device-ID-to-Wallet-Address graph, mapping users‚Äô wallet activity to advertise-able devices. Unlike cookies, user wallet activity is already public on chain, and thus there should be fewer privacy concerns. Armed with such a device-to-wallet graph would enable us to sell and activate targeting data on any ad network (such as Google, Facebook, Twitter, etc.), in addition to our ad units on new browser tabs. That is a huge opportunity.

We believe that user wallet activity is the next frontier of ad targeting, which will be vastly more powerful than cookie segments inferred by user form submissions and page visits. For example, want to target DeFi users that have swapped ETH to USDC in the past 3 months? Easy. Or perhaps you want to target all users who purchased a Bored Ape Yacht Club NFT for more than 50 ETH? Done. Creating targetable user personas based on actual wallet activity is a boon to advertisers that want to go beyond inferred age, sex, location, and income brackets. In the future, advertisers should be able to target wallet addresses that have spent 5 ETH in the last 90 days or Whales who have more than 100 ETH. That certainty about the targeting data is unheard of today and will unleash increased ad spend because suddenly it becomes justifiable to spend more to target higher value personas.

Balancing User Privacy and Advertiser Targeting

But the vision above will require the right balance between protecting privacy and leveraging user data for targeting. Enter the DAO-owned ad network‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääa product that‚Äôs for the community, by the community.

We believe that a community-owned and operated ad network will be best positioned to strike the necessary balance between users and advertisers because the user‚Äôs voice will be a part of the process.

Users (and their data) will be more than just monetizable eyeballs; they will get to decide how much of their privacy they want to monetize‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääand then benefit directly from that monetization. We believe this puts the incentives in the right place, yielding a productive negotiation between Users and Advertisers.

We hope you are as excited as we are to create a better advertising future that‚Äôs built on mutual respect and blockchain-enabled trust.

What about NFT¬†Deals after Demo Day?

NFTDeals.xyz is a front-end to an NFT auction protocol that we built. In the coming months, we‚Äôll allow the community to determine its future direction. Join our Discord server if you‚Äôre interested in participating in that discussion.

As founders, however, we will dedicate our energy to AlphaBack because we believe that is the growth opportunity in this market. This means that we will not be hosting auctions ourselves in the near term. But that‚Äôs the beauty of a permissionless protocol: you can host an auction whenever you want without having to partner with us directly. Simply interact with the published smart contracts in our backend portal or via EtherScan!

Highlights

  • Fundraising. On June 30, 2022, we debuted our product at Tachyon‚Äôs Demo Day using the Stonks platform. It was an incredible event, with over 350 viewers watching the livestream. We received 23 introduction requests from investors, totaling $2M worth of interest.
  • The Pivot, Redux. Last week we began exploring a soft pivot where we would sell the NFT Deals‚Äô backend tooling to major brands. But several customer interviews and investor discussions later, we learned that was not going to be the best opportunity for us in the current market. Simply stated, brands have 12- to 18-month long sales cycles that, combined with the bear market, will result in limited opportunities to validate product market fit. While we considered pursuing that option‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääakin to pushing a boulder uphill‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwe realized that AlphaBack‚Äôs users were growing at 155% compounded daily‚Ää‚Äî‚Äälike a snowball rolling downhill. Not bad given that we haven‚Äôt been actively marketing AlphaBack, besides telling people about it at NFT NYC.

Obstacles

  • Minimizing Gas Fees. The first MVP is almost complete, with gas fee minimization for multi-call USDC payments as the final step. We don‚Äôt want to over-engineer the process, so this version will support up to 100K users. But current estimates show that it will cost approximately $172 in gas fees on Polygon to send USDC to that many users. Not ideal to say the least. We are exploring other options so that users earn as much as possible from advertisers.

How You Can Help

  • Our demo day showed us that there is strong investor interest, so we‚Äôre putting together a pre-seed round. Reply if you have intros to investors who are interested in (1) a veteran team of 10Xers who‚Äôve been working together for ten years, (2) community ownership trends, or (3) ad targeting in a web3, post-cookie world.

Thanks again for your ongoing support

The post Debuted AlphaBack at Tachyon‚Äôs Demo¬†Day appeared first on AlphaBack.
